university.name: Fresno City College
university.description: Fresno City College is a community college in the Central Valley of California.

majors.name: Accounting, Associate in Science
majors.description: The AS Degree in Accounting qualifies the student for entry-level accounting positions in business, government, industry, and financial institutions. Students interested in pursuing a BS Degree in Accounting should consult the catalog of the institution to which they wish to transfer for the specific requirements of that program.

majors.name: Basic Police Academy, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: Demonstrate the ability to communicate effectively and professionally through written, oral and electronic media. Identify the California laws that pertain to the enforcement and procedural aspects of law enforcement, recognizing the violations an officer is likely to encounter and describe the legal obligations in enforcing those laws.

majors.name: Public Safety Dispatcher, Certificate
majors.description: Designed for the student needing to complete the Peace Officer Standards and Training (POST) Public Safety Dispatcher course required under POST Regulation.

majors.name: Supervisor, Certificate
majors.description: Identify basic functions of a Public Safety Dispatcher. Recognize the required state and federal reporting laws as they pertain to a Public Safety Dispatcher.

majors.name: Requalification - Basic Course, Certificate
majors.description: Designed for eligible students under California Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training (POST) PAM Regulation, needing to complete the POST Requalification Course necessary to maintain their Basic POST Certificate.

majors.name: Probation Core Course, Certificate
majors.description: Satisfies all the POST required retraining to become a sworn peace officer in the State of California. Qualified to enter a California Peace Officer's Field Training Program.

majors.name: STC Basic Supervisor, Certificate
majors.description: Identify methodologies of supervision related to the probation and corrections professions. Designed for the student needing to complete the California Standards and Training for Corrections (STC) required course to become a supervisor for a California public safety agency.

majors.name: African-American Studies, Associate in Arts
majors.description: The African American Studies degree is a social science based program designed to focus on the history, heritage, and social culture of African Americans and the African people of the diaspora.

majors.name: American Indian Studies, Associate in Arts
majors.description: American Indian Studies exists to serve Indian and non-Indian students who will be working in any service field, academic or social institution.

majors.name: ASL/English Interpreting, Associate in Arts
majors.description: This degree is designed to prepare students for transfer as a junior to a baccalaureate degree program in American Sign Language (ASL), Deaf Studies or Interpreting.

majors.name: Anthropology for Transfer, Associate in Arts
majors.description: Anthropology is a program designed to acquaint students with human diversity through a broad approach to the study of people including the prehistoric, biological, and cultural perspectives. Because of its wide coverage, anthropology provides a versatile background that serves as a solid foundation for careers in many fields and vocations.

majors.name: Archaeological Technician, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: Students will have demonstrable skills in archaeological field methods. Students will have demonstrable skills in archaeological laboratory methods.

majors.name: Employment Essentials, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: A step incentive certificate signifying proficiency in basic employment skills (includes soft skills, written and oral communication, and problem solving skills). May be awarded after successful completion of units chosen from the list.

majors.name: Architecture, Associate in Science
majors.description: This program provides comprehensive training in architectural design, drafting, and computer-aided design. Students should take courses in the order listed as not all courses are offered each semester.

majors.name: Basic Architectural Contract Documents, Certificate
majors.description: This curriculum is designed to provide beginning knowledge and skills to individuals in the areas of architectural contract documents, accessibility and engineering principles.

majors.name: Basic Architectural Design, Certificate
majors.description: This curriculum is designed to provide beginning knowledge and skills to individuals in the areas of architectural programming, design and presentation.

majors.name: Basic Architecture Skills 1, Certificate
majors.description: This curriculum is designed to provide beginning knowledge and skills to individuals in the areas of architectural design, practice and CAD.

majors.name: Basic Digital Architecture, Certificate
majors.description: This curriculum is designed to provide beginning knowledge and skills to individuals in the area of digital architecture tools including 3D computer modeling and presentation.

majors.name: Basic Architecture Skills 2, Certificate
majors.description: This curriculum focuses on advanced 3D modeling techniques, including object manipulation, material application, and lighting effects using computer-aided design software.

majors.name: Art History for Transfer, Associate in Arts
majors.description: The Associate in Arts in Art History for Transfer Degree offers a core foundation for the study of art history across cultures and eras.

majors.name: Studio Arts for Transfer, Associate in Arts
majors.description: An Associate in Arts in Studio Arts for Transfer is designed for students who plan to complete a bachelor's degree in a similar major at a CSU campus.

majors.name: Studio Art - Three Dimensional Art, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: This program provides comprehensive training in three-dimensional art forms, including sculpture, ceramics, and mixed media. Students develop skills in various materials and techniques.

majors.name: Asian American Studies, Associate in Arts
majors.description: Identify and describe major historical experiences of Asians and Asian Americans. Examine the cultural practices and evaluate how culture has evolved for the Asian American community.

majors.name: Fender Mechanic, Associate in Science
majors.description: Training in this field is designed to prepare the student for employment as an advanced apprentice trainee in body repairing and reconstruction finishing.

majors.name: Automotive Collision Technology, Certificate
majors.description: Designed for students who wish to attend the Automotive Collision Course and go straight into the work force.

majors.name: Automotive Technology Administrator, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: This program provides comprehensive training in automotive technology administration, including diesel technology, chassis systems, and power train systems.

majors.name: Maintenance and Light Repair Technician, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: Satisfactory completion of this curriculum prepares the student for employment as a Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) service technician in the automotive/diesel service facility.

majors.name: Automotive Technology, Associate in Science
majors.description: This program provides comprehensive training in automotive technology, including engine theory, electrical systems, performance, suspension, steering, wheel alignment, power trains, braking systems, and heating/ventilation/air conditioning.

majors.name: Chassis Technician, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: Satisfactory completion of this curriculum prepares the student for employment as an automotive chassis service technician.

majors.name: Diesel Technology, Associate in Science
majors.description: Satisfactory completion of this curriculum prepares the student for entry-level employment as a skilled technician in the diesel technology service and repair industry. Students will perform actual service and repair procedures in the diesel technology laboratory.

majors.name: Emission Technician, Certificate
majors.description: Satisfactory completion of this curriculum prepares the student for employment as an emission service technician.

majors.name: Powertrain Technician, Certificate
majors.description: Satisfactory completion of this curriculum prepares the student for employment as an automotive powertrain service technician.

majors.name: Hybrid Electric Vehicle (HEV), Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: This program provides training in hybrid and electric vehicle systems, focusing on electrical systems and diagnostic procedures to industry standards.

majors.name: Biology - Formerly Life Science Degree, Associate in Science
majors.description: The Associate Degree in Biology provides a foundation for students wishing to explore or pursue a wide range of fields in the Biological Sciences. Students will learn about evolution and evaluate scientific evidence.

majors.name: Biology for Transfer, Associate in Science
majors.description: The goal of the Associate in Science in Biology for Transfer program at Fresno City College is to award students with an associate degree, and provide them with special benefits/guarantees upon transfer to a CSU baccalaureate program in Biology.

majors.name: Field Biologist, Certificate of Achievement
majors.description: The Field Biologist Certificate is a program designed to provide students with education and training in various aspects of field biology in preparation for entry level employment in the environmental consulting field or government agencies, entry level field research assistant positions, and continuing education in biology.

majors.name: Human Biology, Associate in Science
majors.description: The Associate Degree in Human Biology provides a foundation for students exploring or pursuing a range of opportunities in Human Biology or Allied Health fields. The course pathway for this degree includes the foundational courses typically required for entry into Allied Health programs.

majors.name: Business Administration 2.0, Associate in Science
majors.description: Business is an exciting major for students with a variety of interests and career goals including options in entrepreneurship, marketing, business law, management, computer information systems, accounting, and finance.

majors.name: Work Competencies, Certificate
majors.description: A step incentive certificate signifying proficiency in basic knowledge and skills related to human relations and general business concepts required for success in today's competitive economy.

majors.name: Human Resources Assistant, Certificate
majors.description: A step incentive certificate signifying proficiency in basic knowledge and skills required for an entry-level human resource assistant.

organizations.name: Alpha Gamma Sigma (AGS)
organizations.description: Honor society for community college students

organizations.description: Student organization for allied health students

organizations.name: American Sign Language Club (ASL)
organizations.description: Promotes awareness and education of American Sign Language and Deaf culture

organizations.description: Promotes Asian American culture and awareness

organizations.name: Early Childhood Education & Educators Club (ECEE)
organizations.description: Student organization for early childhood education students

organizations.name: Electrical Systems Technology Club (EST)
organizations.description: Student organization for electrical systems technology students

organizations.name: Human Services Student Association
organizations.description: Student organization for human services students

organizations.name: M.E.Ch.A.
organizations.description: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlán - Promotes Chicano culture and awareness

organizations.name: Native American Intertribal Students Association (NAISA)
organizations.description: Promotes Native American culture and awareness

organizations.name: New Media Club
organizations.description: Student organization for new media students

organizations.name: Nutrition & Culinary Club
organizations.description: Student organization for nutrition and culinary students

organizations.name: Science & Engineering Club
organizations.description: Student organization for science and engineering students

organizations.name: Student Success Club
organizations.description: Promotes student success and academic achievement

events.name: Transfer Thursday
events.description: Meet with a Transfer Counselor to learn about the transfer application dates and deadlines, CSU, UC, and HBCU transfer requirements, and ask quick questions about the transfer process.

events.name: Dean's Medallion Reception
events.description: Join us in celebrating student's success in achieving the Dean's Medallion!

events.name: Certificate Ceremony
events.description: Annual certificate ceremony for graduating students

events.name: Commercial Music City Sounds
events.description: This event will highlight the work of the commercial music students in a concert setting.

events.name: FCC Symphonic Band Concert
events.description: This concert features the FCC Symphonic Band in the last concert of the spring semester.

events.name: Fresno Community Concert Band - Remember Our Heroes
Men of Color Summit
events.description: Annual summit for men of color

careers.name: Accounting
careers.description: Entry-level positions in business, government, industry, and financial institutions

careers.name: Law Enforcement
careers.description: Positions in police departments, sheriff's offices, and other law enforcement agencies

careers.name: Automotive Technology
careers.description: Positions in automotive repair and maintenance

careers.name: Biology
careers.description: Entry-level positions in biological sciences and preparation for transfer to four-year institutions

careers.name: Business Administration
careers.description: Entry-level positions in business management, marketing, and administration

careers.name: Nursing
careers.description: Registered Nurse positions in healthcare facilities

careers.name: Dental Hygiene
careers.description: Dental Hygienist positions in dental offices

careers.name: Radiologic Technology
careers.description: Radiologic Technologist positions in healthcare facilities

careers.name: Respiratory Care
careers.description: Respiratory Care Practitioner positions in healthcare facilities
careers.requirements: Respiratory Care Practitioner Associate in Science

careers.name: Welding Technology
careers.description: Welder positions in manufacturing and construction
